short_description: Show an app chooser. Implicit intents may be handled by more than one activity, therefore show an app chooser before launching the intent
Remove unused permissions. They are declared in the manifest but there are no components that need them
Use intents to defer permissions. There are several dangerous permissions that may be avoided just by using intents to perform the same operation
Do not use HttpURLConnection but its secure version HttpsURLConnection and handle possible risk of SSLHandshakeException
Do not enable Javascript interface for a WebView if Javascript is not allowed. Enable it only if the Javascript interface is safe to use
Do not load urls into a WebView if they are not from a whitelist
When using intents, share data carefully
For caches larger than 1 MB, use getExternalCacheDir(). For caches 1 MB or smaller, use getCacheDir()
If your app uses data from external storage, make sure that the contents of the data haven't been corrupted or modified
Do not declare custom permissions with a dangerous protection level
If query(), update(), delete() methods from ContentProvider interface are overridden, check if selection is concatenated with user data and may cause SQL injection
Do not use implicit intents for startService(), bindService(), startActivity() and sendOrderdBroadcast(); use explicit intents
Instead of a localhost network port, use an Android IPC mechanism where authentication is possible
If a service is explicitly exported, declare a permission to protect access to it. If a service declares a permission but it is not explicitly exported, set exported attribute to true
Use a Secure Random Generator to generate keys
If a receiver is explicitly exported, declare a permission to protect access to it
Perform Hostname verification if using SSL Sockets, since they donâ€™t do it by default; perform the verification preferably by calling getDefaultHostnameVerifier() with the expected hostname
Use a recommended cryptographic algorithm if dealing with Cipher, Mac, MessageDigest, Signature objects
